questions.text: Regarding malignant otitis externa (MOE), which of the following statements are correct? i. The causative organism is always Pseudomonas aeruginosa. ii. The fissures of Santorini are implicated in spread of disease. iii. Cranial nerves IX, X, and XI are the most commonly affected cranial nerves. iv. Facial nerve involvement is an independent prognostic indicator. v. There is no difference in predisposition between type I and II diabetes.
Patients requiring revision adenoidectomy were most likely to be from which age group at time of primary adenoidectomy?
Idiopathic laryngotracheal stenosis (ILTS) is a rare inflammatory disease of unknown etiology,it usually affects which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Any ring between the cricoid and carina

options.label: B
options.text: The first and second tracheal rings only

options.label: C
options.text: The second and third tracheal ring

questions.correct_answer: B. The first and second tracheal rings only

questions.text: All of the following may show physical findings in a patient with third-window pathology except?
Noise-induced hearing loss (NIHL) and age-related hearing loss (ARHL) share all of these general characteristics except:
Calculate % handicap for an individual with impairment in hearing right ear 50% & left ear 80% :-
Before actual removal of adenoids the surgeon first do the digital palpation of adenoids for the following reasons; except -

options.label: A
options.text: To detect the size of adenoids

options.label: C
options.text: To push the lateral adenoid mass towards midline

options.label: D
options.text: To push the lingual tonsils medially

questions.correct_answer: D. To push the lingual tonsils medially

questions.text: Kalulal 2 yrs old boy has presented with conductive deafness along with hypoplasia of malar bones and mandible, coloboma of lower lids ; shape of his pinna is malformed.He must be having this syndrome :-
On examination of 40 yr old Jung Bahadur it was found that he is unable to hear high frequency sounds. Most probable site of damage to basal membrane is at :-

A patient of suspected sinusitis has undergone CT scan of sinuses. The radiologist reports an anatomical variation of posterior ethmoid air cell lying in close proximity to optic nerve. Identify the cell?

A woman complains of reduced fetal movements at a period of amenorrhoea of 36 weeks. She has a single fetus in the cephalic presentation. She has no other complications. The fetal heart rate is 140 beats per minute. What is the next step in the management?

options.label: D
options.text: Perform continuous fetal heart rate monitoring for 2 hours.

questions.text: A 25-year-old primipara is in labour. The fetus is in cephalic presentation. The head is engaged. The uterine contractions are two per 10 minutes. At 8 am, the cervical dilatation is 6 cm and at 12 noon it is 7 cm. The membranes are absent. The posterior fontanelle is felt and there is no caput or moulding. The vertex is felt 1 cm above the ischial spines. The pelvis is adequate. The fetal heart rate is 140 beats per minute. What is the best management option?

options.label: C
options.text: Commence continuous fetal heart rate monitoring and observe for 4 hours.

questions.correct_answer: A. Commence an infusion of oxytocin.

questions.text: A woman has a normal vaginal delivery in a peripheral hospital. 10 units of oxytocin is given intramuscularly with the delivery of the anterior shoulder. Controlled cord traction is applied soon after delivery. The placenta is not delivered after 30 minutes. What is the most appropriate management?

options.label: A
options.text: Administer 0.5 mg of ergometrine intravenously and observe for a further period of 30 minutes.

options.label: C
options.text: Commence an oxytocin infusion and carry out manual removal of the placenta.

options.label: D
options.text: Commence an oxytocin infusion and observe for a further period of 30 minutes

questions.correct_answer: C. Commence an oxytocin infusion and carry out manual removal of the placenta.

questions.text: Cord prolapse occurs while performing an amniotomy in a patient in advanced labour. The cervical dilatation is 8 cm. The head is at the level of the ischial spines in the direct occipito-anterior position. The cord is replaced in the vagina immediately. Fetal heart rate is 100 bpm. What is the most appropriate next step in the emergency treatment?

options.label: D
options.text: Push the head up and fill the bladder with normal saline.

questions.correct_answer: D. Push the head up and fill the bladder with normal saline.

questions.text: A woman is getting 3 uterine contractions per 10 minutes. The fetus is in cephalic presentation and the head is not engaged. On vaginal examination, the cervical dilatation is 7 cm. The forehead, supra-orbital ridges and the bridge of the nose are felt. The fetal heart rate is 140 beats per minute. The pelvis is adequate. What is the most appropriate treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Allow labour to continue without interference for 4 hours.

options.label: B
options.text: Carry out manual rotation of the head after full dilatation of the cervix.

options.label: C
options.text: Perform a caesarean section as soon as possible.

options.label: D
options.text: Perform an amniotomy and commence an oxytocin infusion.

questions.correct_answer: C. Perform a caesarean section as soon as possible.

questions.text: A woman is admitted to the antenatal ward at 35 weeks. Her blood pressure is 170/110 mmHg & the urine contains albumin. She has a generalized seizure during examination. An oropharyngeal airway is inserted. Which of the following would be the most appropriate next step in the management?

options.label: A
options.text: Admit to the intensive care unit.

options.label: B
options.text: Give a 10 mg bolus intravenous injection of hydralazine.

options.label: C
options.text: Give a 4 g bolus of magnesium sulphate by slow intravenous injection.

questions.correct_answer: C. Give a 4 g bolus of magnesium sulphate by slow intravenous injection.

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman is admitted at 38 weeks. The fetus is in the cephalic presentation. The head is engaged. The amniotic fluid index is 10, and the umbilical artery end-diastolic velocity and the cardiotocograph are normal. The estimated fetal weight is less than the 10th centile. She has no other pregnancy complications. The cervix is 50% effaced and the os is dilated to 1 cm. What is the next step in the management?

options.label: A
options.text: Insert vaginal prostaglandin to induce labour.

questions.correct_answer: A. Insert vaginal prostaglandin to induce labour.

questions.text: A woman is exposed to chickenpox at a period of amenorrhoea of 14 weeks. She does not give a history of having had the disease previously. What is the next step in the management?

options.label: A
options.text: Administer the varicella vaccine as soon as possible after exposure.

options.label: B
options.text: Administer varicella zoster immuno- globulin and varicella vaccine as soon as possible after exposure.

options.label: C
options.text: Administer varicella zoster immuno- globulin as soon as possible after exposure.

options.label: D
options.text: Test maternal blood for antibodies against varicella-zoster virus.

questions.correct_answer: D. Test maternal blood for antibodies against varicella-zoster virus.

options.label: C
options.text: It does not disappear within 2-3 days

options.label: D
options.text: It is a diffuse oedematous swelling of the soft tissues of the scalp

questions.correct_answer: C. It does not disappear within 2-3 days

options.label: B
options.text: The male as well as the female partner

questions.text: Mifepristone is not used in:

A 25-year-old primipara is in labour at a POA of 40 weeks. The cervical dilatation is 5 cm. She is getting 1-2 uterine contractions per 10 minutes. On vaginal examination, the eyes, nose and mouth are felt. The chin is anterior. The membranes are absent. The pelvis is adequate. The fetal heart rate is 140 beats per minute. What is the best management option?

options.label: A
options.text: Allow labour to continue without any interference.

options.label: C
options.text: Commence epidural analgesia and continuous fetal heart rate monitoring.

questions.correct_answer: A. Allow labour to continue without any interference.

questions.text: About group B streptococcal carrier in pregnancy, which statement is true?

options.label: A

options.label: D
options.text: Metronidazole is the drug of choice

A 55 year old man presented with left flank pain and 2 episodes of hematuria. He is recently diagnosed hypertensive and his Hb is 17.4 gm%, KFT and LFT were normal. CT scan showed a 4 * 3 cm lesion at the lower pole of left kidney. What is the ideal treatment for this patient?

A 4 year old boy presented with painless abdominal lump with one episode of hematuria. The lump is firm, bossellated, not crossing the midline. CT scan image in given below. The familial form of this condition is associated with which chromosome?

A 65 year old female presented with weakness, lethargy, excessive cold intolerance and decreased ankle jerk. On thyroid function test her TSH was 16 mU/L (N- .4-4 mU/L), T4 was 0.3 ngm/ml (N- 0,6 – 1.6 ngm/ml) and T4 is 70 pgm/dl (N- 230 – 619 pgm/dl). What is the most appropriate treatment for her?

options.label: A
options.text: Start levothyroxine at 100 Mcgm then decrease dose gradually

options.label: B
options.text: Start levothyroxine at 25 mcg then increase dose gradually

options.label: C
options.text: Start levothyroxine at 25 mcg then decrease dose gradually

questions.correct_answer: B. Start levothyroxine at 25 mcg then increase dose gradually

questions.text: A patient presented with hard breast lump 6 × 4 cm with one fixed lymph node. After evaluation of lump diagnosis of infiltrating cancer was made. No metastasis was found. What is the ideal treatment for this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Neo adjuvant chemotherapy followed MRM then adjuvant Chemotherapy

questions.correct_answer: C. Neo adjuvant chemotherapy followed MRM then adjuvant Chemotherapy

questions.text: A trauma patient was brought to emergency who has cold clammy skin, increased JVP prominent neck veins and heart sound were not audible. Patient died in the hospital. Autopsy finding is given in the image. What is most probable cause of death.

A patient presented with right upper abdominal pain. MRCP image in given below. Next step in the management of this patient?
False statement about salivary gland tumour is?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common site of adenoid cystic tumour is Hard palate.

options.label: B
options.text: Acinic cell tumour is most commonly seen in submandibular gland

options.label: D
options.text: Benign Pleomorphic adenoma of deep lobe of parotid is best treated by total conservative parotidectomy.

questions.correct_answer: B. Acinic cell tumour is most commonly seen in submandibular gland

questions.text: You are posted as MO at PHC level and in field visit you do Blood Pressure screening. Which level of prevention is it?

Cohort study is considered better than case control study for establishing a causal association because:

options.label: A
options.text: It satisfies the condition of temporality (cause before effect)

options.label: B
options.text: It requires a long period of follow up.

options.label: C
options.text: It makes comparisons between two groups

options.label: D
options.text: It can be used to study rare conditions.

questions.correct_answer: A. It satisfies the condition of temporality (cause before effect)

questions.text: A test was developed and tested for a disease on a population in whom the prevalence of the disease was 25%. The test was found to have a sensitivity of 95% and specificity of 70%. What is the probability of someone with negative test to not have the disease?

In a Kindergarten class of 25 children, two teachers and one helper, one child had measles 2 weeks later, 6 children had measles. The adults had prior attack of measles, but the vaccination status of the children is not known. What is the secondary attack rate?

A 27-year-old male from rural village presented to the PHC complaining of blister formation and worms coming out of it, accompanied by fever. The condition was diagnosed as guinea worm disease. This condition is a common public health problem which is attributed to the use of?
For the population of 10000, Trench method sanitary landfill pit of depth of 2 cm is to be constructed. Which of the following is the correct area required per year?

A 26-year-old male from a rural village was diagnosed with malaria. The physician in the PHC advised his family members to take precautions from mosquitoes by using nets and repellents. Which of the following is correct for mosquito net?

options.label: D
options.text: Prevents transmission of all vectors borne diseases.

questions.text: A 56-year-old smoker had cough, past 3 weeks although he has completely stopped smoking since then. Now he has vomiting, fatigue, weigh loss of 6 kg. he acts confused and is not oriented to place and time. A blood examination shows serum sodium 115mEq/L, calcium levels are normal. Chest CT shows a Small lesion in the wall of the peri hilar bronchus and a few perihilar lymph nodes. Which of the following is correct explanation of this patients manifestations?

options.label: A
options.text: Squamous cell carcinoma with intracranial metastasis

options.label: B
options.text: Squamous cell carcinoma with a paraneoplastic manifestation

options.label: C

options.text: Small cell carcinoma with paraneoplastic manifestations

questions.correct_answer: D. Small cell carcinoma with paraneoplastic manifestations

questions.correct_answer: B. Frozen sections Oil red O

questions.text: A 45-year lady was diagnosed of breast carcinoma. On IHC the tumor was ER+, PR+ Her 2 Neu –ve, Ki67 index of the tumor is high (22%). The correct designation and outcome of the tumor is
Which of the following changes in the base pair of a gene will lead to severe most diseases?

options.label: C
options.text: Replacement of one base pair leading to stop codon

options.label: D
options.text: Replacement of one base pair leading to different codon

questions.correct_answer: A. Deletion of one base pair

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: A. Patient presents with painless diminution of vision acute red eye

questions.text: A one-month old baby is brought with complaints of photophobia and watering. Clinical examination shows normal tear passages and clear but large cornea. The most likely diagnosis is:

questions.text: 65-year-old man underwent cataract surgery with placement of a posterior chamber IOL. He presents 2 years later with mild redness and blurred vision. On examination, there was low-grade inflammation and anterior chamber cellular reaction. The cause for this condition can be due to:
Which extraocular muscle is inserted behind the centre of rotation and when it contracts, the anterior portion of the eye is abducted and extorted.

options.label: A
options.text: There is weakness or disinsertion of the levator palpebrae superioris from the anterior surface of the tarsus

options.label: C
options.text: Frontalis sling operation is treatment in severe cases

questions.correct_answer: A. There is weakness or disinsertion of the levator palpebrae superioris from the anterior surface of the tarsus

questions.text: A 5-year-old child is brought to a pediatric clinic by his mother for a rash that started a few days ago. She adds that her son also has had a fever and sore throat since last week. His immunizations are up—to-date. On examination, a rash is present over the trunk and upper extremities that feels like sandpaper to the touch. The oropharyngeal examination is suggestive of exudative pharyngitis with a white coat over the tongue. The physician swabs the throat and uses the swab in a rapid antigen detection test kit. He also sends the sample for a microbiological culture. The physician then recommends empiric antibiotic therapy and tells the mother that if the boy is left untreated, the likelihood of developing a complication later in life is very high. Which of the following best explains the mechanism underlying the development of the possible complication the physician is talking about?

After 11 days in the intensive care unit following an automobile accident, an 18-year-old woman develops increased urinary urgency, burning during urination, and lower abdominal pain. When her urine is cultured, a red pigment is observed in the Petri dish as shown in the image. What is the most likely organism causing these symptoms?

A young girl living in rural area is brought to her pediatrician with complaints of fever, cough, and fatigue for the past 2 weeks. The physician notices that the patient is having intermittent bouts of many coughs in a single breath, followed by a deep inspiration. The parents report that this pattern of coughing had started in the past 2 days. The physician informs them that their daughter will most likely recover with only supportive care. A swab is obtained from the posterior nasopharynx is sent for culture for a specific organism. Which of the following culture media will be used?

options.label: B
options.text: Charcoal yeast extract with iron and cysteine

options.label: C

questions.text: A 32-year-old man presents to the emergency department because of shortness of breath and palpitations. He and his family recentlyimmigrated from Peru. X-ray of the chest demonstrates pulmonary congestion. Echocardiography reveals biventricular dilatation withmassive cardiac enlargement. Endomyocardial biopsy demonstrates the presence of intracellular protozoan parasites as shown in the image. Which vector is most likely responsible for transmitting this patient's disease?

A 43-year-old PLHIV woman comes to the clinic complaining of fever, headache, and vision problems that have lasted for the past few days. She reports that she has had to discontinue her daily visits to the park to feed the pigeons because of her worsening symptoms. questions.text: A 52-year-old man comes to the physician complaining of a skin rash that Is extremely painful. A picture of the rash is shown in the image. A pathology specimen is obtained. Which of the following results would most likely be seen on biopsy?

A 32-year-old pregnant woman had a near fatal illness after ingesting river water on a trip abroad. questions.correct_answer: B. A-T- B-F, C-F, D-T, E-T

questions.text: Match the following
A patient comes to the OPD with complaints of daily purulent sputum production. Identify the condition given in this image?
A 34-year-old male complaints of lower back pain for six months. He is previously diagnosed as a case of ulcerative colitis. X-ray picture of lumbar spine given below. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old female came to the OPD with complaints of dysphagia and recurrent episodes of chest pain. The patient was further evaluated with barium swallow which is shown below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
A 35-year-old male presented with pain and swelling around the wrist joint. There is no history of injury. Comment based on the X-ray shown below.
Most radiosensitive organ in the body is:

A 35-year-old female suffers from third degree burns over 75% of his body. Her effective circulating volume and renal perfusion pressure drop precipitously and the concentration of NaCl in the tubular fluid in the kidney decreases. These conditions will cause an increase in which of the following by the kidney?
Which of the following is NOT TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: Entry of Na+ during the depolarization phase causes opening of more voltage-gated Na+ channels and further depolarization, setting up a positive feedback loop.

options.label: B
options.text: During the rapid upstroke phase the membrane potential moves toward the equilibrium potential for Na+ (+60 mV).

options.label: C
options.text: The Na+ channels rapidly enter a closed state called the inactivated state

options.label: D
options.text: Efflux of K+ through slow voltage-gated K+ channels bring the action potential to an end and cause closure of their gates through a positive feedback process.

questions.correct_answer: D. Efflux of K+ through slow voltage-gated K+ channels bring the action potential to an end and cause closure of their gates through a positive feedback process.

questions.text: A man falls into a deep sleep with one arm under his head. This arm is paralyzed when he awakens, but it tingles, and pain sensation in it is still intact. The reason for the loss of motor function without loss of pain sensation is -

options.label: A
options.text: A fibers are more susceptible to hypoxia than B fibers.

options.label: B
options.text: A fibers are more sensitive to pressure than C fibers.

options.label: C
options.text: C fibers are more sensitive to pressure than A fibers.

options.label: D
options.text: Motor nerves are more affected by sleep than sensory nerves

questions.correct_answer: B. A fibers are more sensitive to pressure than C fibers.

questions.text: The oxygen taken up by the lungs is 200mL per minute. Oxygen concentration in samples taken from systemic and pulmonary artery is 0.2mL/mL and 0.16mL/mL respectively. What is the cardiac output?
Which of the following innervate the extensor gamma motor neuron?
Children with autism exhibit all of the following except

options.label: B
options.text: They may be very sensitive to specific sounds

options.label: C
options.text: They often prefer imaginative play with dolls

options.label: D
options.text: They often perform repetitive stereotyped behaviors

questions.correct_answer: C. They often prefer imaginative play with dolls

questions.text: Most common psychiatric sequel after ischemic stroke in elderly?

A 55-year-old man complains of inability to achieve an erection. He has been worried about his health recently and takes antihypertensive medication. Which of the following would most likely differentiate between an organic and psychiatric condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Magnetic resonance imaging of the lumbosacral spine

options.label: C
options.text: An erection on awakening in the morning

questions.correct_answer: C. An erection on awakening in the morning

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect about neuroleptic induced dystonia :

options.label: A
options.text: It is caused by contractions of muscles resulting in abnormal movements of postures .

options.label: B
options.text: Characteristically these symptoms appear early in treatment with neuroleptics.

options.label: C
options.text: Young men appear to be at increased risk

questions.correct_answer: D. It is a benign condition

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect concerning the symptoms of PMDD?

options.label: A
options.text: They may include impaired concentration, Insomnia or hypersomnia

options.label: B
options.text: They have been reported to be absent during nonovulatory cycles

options.label: C
options.text: They may be related to how an individual’s brain reacts to normal variations in the serum levels of gonadotropins .

options.label: D
options.text: They may be caused by late luteal phase falls in the levels of progesterone and estradiol .

questions.correct_answer: D. They may be caused by late luteal phase falls in the levels of progesterone and estradiol .

questions.text: Pulmonary complications are seen/expected in all except

options.label: C
options.text: Patient with 7 pack years of smoking

questions.correct_answer: C. Patient with 7 pack years of smoking

questions.text: A 36-year-old patient presents to the operating room for an appendectomy under general anesthesia. He gives a history of chronic alcohol abuse. Which of the following is the correct statement regarding this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: MAC of sevoflurane will be unchanged

options.label: D
options.text: MAC of sevoflurane will initially increase and then decrease

questions.correct_answer: C. MAC of sevoflurane will increase

questions.text: Which of the following is responsible for generation of toxic by-products on long term use of inhaled anesthetic agents in closed circuit ventilation with soda lime as CO2 absorber?
Which of the following landmarks are used to perform caudal epidural block?
Transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation is used to relieve pain. What is the mechanism?
1) Carboluria is seen in acute poisoning with
“Spirits of Hartshorn” refers to which of the following alkali?
The thickness of outer table of skull is

options.label: A
options.text: Same as that of the inner table

options.label: D
options.text: One-third of that of inner table

questions.correct_answer: B. Twice that of inner table

questions.text: The usual fatal dose of white phosphorus is
In India a boy below ____ years can not be charged with rape?

options.label: D
options.text: There is no such age limit

questions.text: A patient was treated with steroids for psoriasis. On stopping the treatment he develops fever, malaise and lesions as seen in the image below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
All of the following infections present with maculopapular rash except?

A patient presents with flaccid bullous lesions involving the oral cavity and the skin. He has lesion as shown in the below picture. Acantholytic cells are seen on Tzanck smear. What is most probable diagnosis?
A female came with foul smelling grey white discharge and on examination, one of these will be seen on microscopy

options.label: A
options.text: Epithelial cells present with bacteria on margins

questions.correct_answer: A. Epithelial cells present with bacteria on margins

questions.text: A child presents with a bald patch on the scalp with easy pluckability of hair. Physician noticed black dots on the area. Treatment to be given will be?

A 42 year old female presents with tingling and numbness in right hand that awakens her in the middle of the night for last two weeks. She also gives history of being treated for diabetes and hypothyroidism for last 3 years by an endocrinologist. Which of the following ain’t true about this condition from the following options ?

options.label: A
options.text: Splintage is helpful only in few initial months of onset of symptoms

options.label: B
options.text: Motor Symptoms appear early in the course of the disease

options.label: C
options.text: Durakn’s Test is the most specific clinical test in the diagnosis

options.label: D
options.text: It is the most common focal compression neuropathy

questions.correct_answer: B. Motor Symptoms appear early in the course of the disease

questions.text: A 25 year old soccer player complained of injury to right knee 6 months ago. Now he says that there is a feeling of sudden giving away of knee joint with knee in 90 degree flexion which completely disappears when the knee is taken into complete extension. Which of the following ligament needs to be checked ?
All of the following are included in Phemister’s Triad except :
Steps in the operative correction of congenital talipes equinovarus include all of the following except

options.label: C
options.text: Release of peroneus brevis from its insertion

questions.correct_answer: C. Release of peroneus brevis from its insertion

questions.text: Which of the following Implant terminology doesn't match with its Mechanism of Action?
questions.correct_answer: D. Steinmann's Pin: Three Point Fixation

questions.text: All of the following the clinical findings are consistent with severe mitral stenosis except
questions.correct_answer: C. Opening snap late after S2

questions.text: A 40-year-old male has a fracture of femur. Biochemical evaluation revealed serum calcium 12.8 mg/dl(high), serum phosphorus 2.3 mg/dl(low), alkaline phosphatase 300 IU/L and blood urea 32 mg/dl. Which of the following is the most probable diagnosis in his case ?
“Morning dip” in peak expiratory flows is a feature of:
Which of the following contacts with a patient infected with tuberculosis is most likely to develop the disease?

options.label: A
options.text: The child of a parent with smear-negative, culture-positive pulmonary tuberculosis

options.label: B
options.text: The co-worker in a small office of a patient with laryngeal tuberculosis

options.label: C
options.text: The HIV-negative partner of an HIV-infected patient with pulmonary tuberculosis

options.label: D
options.text: The spouse of a patient with miliary tuberculosis

questions.correct_answer: B. The co-worker in a small office of a patient with laryngeal tuberculosis

questions.text: A 50 year old male is taking digoxin for last one year without regular follow up with the physician. Which one of the following ECG findings represents a manifestation of digitalis toxicity?
questions.correct_answer: B. Atrial tachycardia with variable block

questions.text: A patient diagnosed with angina is prescribed trimetazidine.Trimetazidine helps in angina by inhibition of:
questions.correct_answer: A. Beta oxidation of fatty acids

questions.text: A 10 year old child develops symptoms and signs of hepatitis twice within a period of 2 months.The most likely cause is
A 14 year old boy is diagnosed to have Bartter syndrome.All the following will be the manifestations except
A 60 year old male with type 2 diabetes and chronic kidney disease (stage G5) developed seizures. Which of the following is the mechanism of seizure in this patient
A patient has epigastric rising sensations which he described as panic like feelings, déjà vu and lip smacking, chewing and hand wringing. The most likely cause of these manifestations is
Perifollicular haemorrhage with salt and pepper appearance is seen in which vitamin deficiency

An Alcoholic man presents with painful swelling of great toe. On lab tests- serum uric acid is normal. Synovial fluid analysis showed increased WBCs. There is no history of fever, trauma or dysuria.What is the likely cause of this presentation
A patient met with road traffic accident.On MRI it was revealed that he had injury to lateral part of dorsal column at cervical region.What will be the clinical manifestation
questions.correct_answer: A. Proprioception loss at I/L arm

questions.text: A patient with HIV has CD4 count of less than 100/mm3.The likely opportunistic infection will be
Which of the following is not a part of metabolic syndrome?

A 62-year-old woman presents with gradually progressive cognitive decline, along with stiffness, slowness, and intermittent jerks of her right upper extremity. Her speech has become monotone, slurred, and slow. On examination, she has dystonic posturing of the right arm with increased rigidity and bradykinesia. There is also intermittent myoclonus when the right arm is held up. When speaking, the patient’s right arm will seemingly rise on its own and she will use the left arm to pull it back down. Her family feels that she often neglects the right side of her body. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?
Torsades de pointes is characterized by all of the following except:
questions.correct_answer: D. Most common risk is hyperkalemia

questions.text: Diagnostic features of allergic bronchopulmonary aspergillosis (ABPA) include all of the following features, except :-

options.label: D
options.text: Occurrence in patients with old cavitatory lesions

questions.correct_answer: D. Occurrence in patients with old cavitatory lesions

questions.text: Which of the following clinical sign is demonstrated in the image above.

A 50 year old male with dyspnoea, dry cough and fatigue. Pulmonary functions shows typically restrictive pattern in PFT. HRCT (High resolution CT) shows honey combing in subpleural zone and basal locations. Probable diagnosis is

A 60 year old man came with periodic jaw and neck pain with ipsilateral carotid artery tenderness. He had history of dental extraction 1 month back. All his blood counts are normal.The likely diagnosis is

A 30-year-old woman is in the intensive care unit with rhabdomyolysis due to road traffic accident. Her clinical course has been complicated by acute renal failure and severe pain. An electrocardiogram (ECG) is obtained showing short QT interval. What is the most appropriate course of action at this point?

An anxious young woman who is taking birth control pills presents to the emergency room with shortness of breath.You are suspecting pulmonary embolism. The absence of which of the following would make the diagnosis of pulmonary embolus unlikely?

A 60-year-old woman presents with symptoms of weight loss, anxiety, and palpitations. On examination, she has a thyoid goiter.On lab tests Free T4 is high with low TSH. Which of the following will not be a cardiac finding
A female with known case of rheumatoid arthritis has this finger deformity as shown in the figure.This deformity is known as

A 2-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department after 5 days of vomiting and diarrhea, His only oral intake over the past 2 days has been popsicles and small amounts of water. He has a heart rate of 116 beats/min, respiratory rate of 22 breaths/min. and blood pressure of 90/56 mm Hg. The boy is lethargic, his mucous membranes are dry, and his capillary refill time is more than 2 seconds. Laboratory study results are shown: Laboratory Test: Serum sodium 120 mEq/L (120 mmol/L) Blood urea nitrogen 28 mg/dL (10 mmol/L) Serum creatinine 0.5 mg/dL (44.2 ?mol/L) Serum glucose 90 mg/dL (5 mmol/L) Of the following, the laboratory data that are MOST consistent with this child's condition are

options.label: A
options.text: High serum osmolality high urine osmolality, low urine sodium

options.label: B
options.text: Low serum osmolality, high urine osmolality, high urine sodium

options.label: C
options.text: Low serum osmolality, high urine osmolality, low urine sodium

options.label: D
options.text: Low serum osmolality, low urine osmolality, low urine sodium

questions.correct_answer: C. Low serum osmolality, high urine osmolality, low urine sodium

questions.text: A 16-year-old adolescent girl is seen for a health supervision visit. She was evaluated 1 month ago at the emergency department for acute-onset chest pain; she was found to have a left-sided spontaneous pneumothorax and underwent urgent needle decompression. She was discharged to home after 4 days and recovered fully within a week. Today, the girl's height and weight are at the 98th and 40th percentile, respectively. She has a long and narrow face, a high-arched palate, malar hypoplasia, joint laxity, tong fingers, and asymmetry on forward bending. She wears glasses for high myopia. Of the following, the MOST common cause of morbidity and mortality in individuals affected by this adolescent's condition is

A 4-month-oid male infant born at 30 weeks’ gestation is admitted to the hospital in November with respiratory distress. He has a 4-day history of copious rhinorrhea associated with cough and a 2-day history of fever. He has reduced appetite. His urine output has been adequate. On admission, he has a temperature of 40 °C, respiratory rate of 65 breaths/min, oxygen saturation of 92% on room air, heart rate of 140 beats/min, and blood pressure of 92/60 mm Hg. His physical examination findings are remarkable for subcostal retractions and bilateral rhonchi with expiratory wheezing on lung auscultation. Laboratory data are shown: Laboratory Test White blood cell 21,000/?L (2.1 x 109/L) Lymphocytes 70% Neutrophils 30% Hemoglobin 13 g/dL (130 g/L) Platelet count 200 x 103/?L (200 x 109/L) C-reactive protein 20 mg/dL (200 mg/L) Blood culture results are pending. A chest radiograph shows bilateral hyperinflation, peri bronchial thickening, and patchy opacification. Of the following, the BEST next step in the management of this infant is to Initiate
What is the drug of choice for absence seizures in children?

A 2-day-old term neonate has a total serum bilirubin concentration of 7.6 mg/dl (130 ?mol/L) and conjugated serum bilirubin of 2.3 mg/dL (39.3 ?mol/L). He is breastfeeding and bottle feeding, and has had a 2% weight loss since birth. Physical examination findings are remarkable for a head circumference of 32 cm. Ultrasonography of the abdomen shows a contracted gallbladder with no with no evidence of biliary atresia. Of the following, the MOST likely cause of this neonate’s findings is
Which of the following is a bad ominous sign in a 7 days old baby?

A 14 years old adolescent girl is brought to the emergency department 30 minutes after she collapsed while walking with a friend. She is awake and able to follow commands but is not speaking. Her pupils are equal, round, and reactive to light; extraocular movements are intact, and she can close her eyes completely. Her smile is asymmetric. She is moving her left arm and leg vigorously; there is minimal movement in the right arm and leg. She is unable to ambulate. A head computed tomography scan is normal. The girl is admitted to the pediatric intensive care unit for observation with a diagnosis of seizure with a post-ictal paralysis Over the next 12 hours, the girl's hemiparesis remains unchanged. Her friend reports that the girl collapsed while walking; she did not lose consciousness, had no abnormal movements, and was unable to get up or speak. Of the following, the BEST next diagnostic study to order in the management of this child is
What is the drug of choice for partial epilepsy in children?

A female neonate in the newborn nursery has a heart rate of 60 beats/min. She is in no acute distress. Her heart has an irregular rate and rhythm with 2+ brachial and femoral pulses without delay, her lungs are clear bilaterally, and there is no cyanosis or peripheral edema. There is a diffuse rash characterized by elliptical erythematous, papulosquamous lesions with central clearing, annular erythema, and a fine scale. Electrocardiography is performed. Of the following, the finding MOST often associated with this neonate's condition is

A 6-year-old is seen for a health supervision visit. He attends the first grade in a regular education classroom and is doing well. He has multiple café au lait macules on his body, at least 6 of which are larger than 5 mm, and axillary freckling. A 3-generation pedigree is obtained Of the following, the inheritance pattern for this boy's condition is
questions.correct_answer: B. Autosomal dominant with variable expressivity
